page.title: 01RINSEY BEACH
page.content: Rinsey Beach is to the west of Porthleven. There are cliffs above the beach. At the top of the cliffs there is a strip of rough grass and further inland, fields and grassland. There is just one farm. People often go to the beach at Rinsey. Some go surfing there because of the big waves but the sea is dangerous to swim in. There is a house at the edge of the cliff. I would not like to live there myself. There are rock pools on the beach and lots of plants and flowers on the cliffs, especially sea pinks. There is a marsh at Rinsey. Much of the area belongs to the National Trust. A rough track leads from Rinsey village to the small car park. The coastal footpath goes to the east and west and another footpath leads down to the beach.
